@graph.parties: VOLVO TRUCKS NORTH AMERICA, INC. v. REEDER-SIMCO GMC, INC.
@graph.reasoning: Robinson-Patman Act claim: primary line, secondary line, and tertiary line.
Private plaintiff may recover threefold for actual injury sustained as a result of a violation of the Robinson-Patman Act.

@graph.parties: J. Truett Payne Co. v. Chrysler Motors Corp.
@graph.reasoning: Robinson-Patman Act does not ban all price differences charged to different purchasers of commodities of like grade and quality.

@graph.parties: Brooke Group Ltd. v. Brown & Williamson Tobacco Corp.
@graph.reasoning: Robinson-Patman Act proscribes price discrimination only to the extent that it threatens to injure competition.
Robinson-Patman Act cases typically refer to 'favored' and 'disfavored' purchasers.
Hallmark of the requisite competitive injury is the diversion of sales or profits from a disfavored purchaser to a favored purchaser.

@graph.parties: Falls City Industries, Inc. v. Vanco Beverage, Inc.
@graph.reasoning: Permissible inference of competitive injury may arise from evidence that a favored competitor received a significant price reduction over a substantial period of time.
Permissible inference of competitive injury may arise from evidence that a favored competitor received a significant price reduction over a substantial period of time.
